decision_conditions: The Austrian Pine is situated in the rear garden of the property at the far end, on the eastern boundary. The tree does not appear to have been pruned (reduced) before and, as a result, has retained an attractive, natural looking crown, typical of this species. The tree is highly visible and has a high amenity value.

The reasons given are not viewed as justified reasons for carrying out this level of pruning. It would unnecessarily introduce multiple wounds into the crown of this tree which would likely lead to infection. Additionally, the proposed work would reduce the size and amenity value of this tree, and would be detrimental to the natural appearance of this tree.
The crown of this tree is not currently considered to be in need of reducing and therefore the proposed work is unnecessary and unjustified.
Conclusion: The proposed work is unnecessary, unjustified and will have a detrimental impact on the health and appearance of this tree and the amenity and arboreal character of
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
description: to carry out reduction on one Austrian Pine (T8 on TPO 409), by removing 1-2m of secondary growth in height and on sides.
